title: Red Fort, temples on radar? 8 suspects with Bangladesh, Pak links held for plotting terror attack
content: Eight individuals with alleged links to Pakistan's ISI and Bangladesh-based extremist groups were apprehended in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal. Intelligence reports indicated a potential terror plot targeting Delhi's Red Fort and prominent temples. The arrests followed specific inputs about a module planning subversive activities, with digital materials being analyzed to uncover a wider network.

title: PM Modi to flag off 'Meerut Metro' and 'Namo Bharat' train today — how will it help commuters?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Meerut Metro and Namo Bharat RRTS on Sunday. This marks the full operationalisation of the 82-km Delhi-Meerut corridor. The integrated network promises faster travel between cities and within Meerut. It aims to reduce travel time significantly, boost connectivity, and lower carbon emissions.

title: ‘Why now?’: Gavaskar questions timing of Super 8 pre-seeding row at T20 World Cup
content: Fans are criticising the T20 World Cup's pre-seeding format, which placed strong group winners in the same Super 8 group. However, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar questioned the timing of this outrage, suggesting logistical complexities for the ICC in a multi-country tournament. He highlighted international travel and accommodation as potential reasons for advance group assignments.

title: Sisters, aged 25 and 23, found dead a day before wedding in Jodhpur; no suicide note recovered
content: Two sisters, Shobha (25) and Vimla (23), were found dead at their Jodhpur home on Friday, just a day before their scheduled weddings.  They were rushed to a hospital around 4 am after their health suddenly deteriorated, but were declared dead on arrival. Preliminary investigations suggest poisoning, with the post-mortem report to confirm the exact cause.

title: What is Anthropic's new AI tool that wiped off billions from cybersecurity stocks
content: Anthropic's new AI tool, Claude Code Security, scans for code vulnerabilities, prompting a multi-billion dollar stock market crash in the cybersecurity sector. While existing scanners use pattern matching, this AI reasons like a human researcher, identifying complex flaws. Despite its research preview status and human oversight requirement for fixes, the market reacted sharply to the potential disruption.

title: AI push, tribute to Jayalalithaa: Key takeaways from PM Modi’s 131st Mann Ki Baat address
content: Prime Minister Modi, in his Mann Ki Baat address, highlighted AI's role in animal healthcare and agriculture, showcasing innovations at the AI Impact Summit. He also remembered Jayalalithaa, urged embracing Indian culture over foreign influences, and cautioned against digital fraud, emphasizing the importance of local products and organ donation.

title: Bezos's ex-wife's record $7.2bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', Musk agrees
content: Philanthropist Mackenzie Scott has donated billions at an unprecedented pace, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach as "bad." Tan argues her lack of oversight fosters mismanagement, likening it to "pouring sugar on the floor" and citing examples of alleged chaos and unintended consequences at recipient organizations.

title: ‘She’s a vegetarian, I’m not’: JD Vance reveals ‘best and worst’ dish he cooked for wife Usha
content: US Vice-President JD Vance humorously recounted his early culinary struggles, admitting his first attempt at cooking for his wife, Usha, was "inedible." While his initial vegetarian dish failed spectacularly, Vance has since mastered baking, with brioche and Japanese milk bread now among his best creations. The couple, married since 2010, are expecting their fourth child.

title: Mohd Amir defends Abhishek Sharma ‘slogger’ jibe, repeats India won’t reach semis
content: Former Pakistan bowler Mohammad Amir reignited controversy at the T20 World Cup with a renewed attack on India's Abhishek Sharma, questioning his defensive technique. Amir also reiterated his prediction that India will not reach the semi-finals, citing stronger performances from teams like South Africa and the West Indies.

title: ‘Very touched’: Lula reacts after Portuguese songs played during lunch with PM Modi
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva was touched by India's musical tribute during his state visit, recalling a similar gesture he made for PM Modi in Brazil. The visit saw both leaders aiming to boost bilateral trade to $20 billion in five years and signing agreements on rare earth minerals, digital partnership, and mining cooperation.

title: FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: All you need to know
content: Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting ATMs with 'jackpotting' malware, forcing machines to dispense cash without legitimate transactions. The FBI warns of a surge in these attacks, with significant financial losses reported. Threat actors exploit physical and software vulnerabilities, bypassing security to gain direct control and trigger rapid cash withdrawals, often leaving ATMs unexpectedly out of service.

title: 'Set private parts on fire': Tripura teen brutally assaulted by live-in partner in Gurgaon
content: A 19-year-old university student in Gurgaon has accused her live-in partner of horrific violence, including pouring sanitiser on her private parts and attempting to set them ablaze. The man allegedly subjected her to brutal assaults, filmed compromising videos, and threatened her ability to walk or have children. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating the case.

title: US envoy sparks row by claiming Israel has a right to much of Middle East
content: Pakistan and thirteen other nations have strongly condemned US Ambassador Mike Huckabee's remarks endorsing Israel's biblical claim to Arab lands. The joint statement, issued by foreign ministers and regional bodies, denounced the comments as a violation of international law and a threat to regional stability.

title: T20 World Cup: How Tilak Varma's form is correlated with Abhishek Sharma
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign has seen batting trump cards Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma struggle, with their form appearing correlated. Captain Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged Varma's struggles but expressed confidence, while highlighting the team's strategy to allow batters to play their natural game when possible. The team management is backing the duo, aiming to replicate their previous success.

title: Matthew Tkachuk denies ‘psychological warfare’ claims vs Sidney Crosby
content: Matthew Tkachuk made it clear Team USA will not rely on mind games against Sidney Crosby ahead of the Olympic gold medal clash with Canada. Instead, the Americans are leaning on discipline, depth, and belief after a strong semifinal win. With Crosby’s status uncertain and Canada still dangerous, the final will test Team USA’s composure and championship readiness.

title: Who is Pernille Døsvik? Inside Johannes Klæbo’s fiancée and love story
content: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo is one of the biggest stars in winter sports. The Norwegian cross-country skier has dominated the Olympics and World Cup circuit for years. Off the snow, his personal life has also drawn attention. Klæbo is engaged to Pernille Døsvik, a young professional from Trondheim. The couple confirmed their engagement in June 2025 after several years together. Fans often see her supporting him during competitions and training periods.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: Trump's tariffs struck down, what's next? Here's what SBI suggests
content: The US Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Trump's tariff framework has introduced a new dynamic.  While this lifts policy uncertainty, countries must now navigate a "counter-intuitive" negotiation period.  The executive branch has swiftly implemented a temporary 10% global import tariff using a different trade act, with Congress holding the ultimate power to extend it.

title: Selection headache or perfect balance? Shastri flags India’s dilemma ahead of Super 8s
content: India's unbeaten run in the T20 World Cup highlights their formidable depth, a strength that also presents their sole selection dilemma. Former coach Ravi Shastri believes the winning combination will likely remain intact against South Africa, emphasising flexibility and the need for extra bowling options, especially with dew a factor.

title: Delhi on high alert: Hawk-eye on vehicles entering city after intel warns of strikes
content: Security agencies have heightened vigilance in Delhi following intelligence of a potential LeT terror plot targeting religious and heritage sites, including a Chandni Chowk temple. This alert follows a previous blast near the same temple. Paramilitary forces are deployed, vehicles are being inspected, and CCTV surveillance is intensified. Local stakeholders and various establishments are also undergoing verification.

title: 'Bombed our civilian compatriots': 'Dozens' killed after Pakistan conducts airstrikes in Afghanistan
content: Afghanistan reported dozens killed and wounded after Pakistan conducted airstrikes in eastern border provinces, targeting alleged militant camps. Pakistan stated the strikes were in response to recent suicide attacks, including one by an Afghan national. Tensions escalate as Pakistan warns of further action if Afghan soil is used for terrorism.

title: T20 World Cup | Focus squarely on India's batting but bowling is the real deal
content: While India's batting line-up has dominated the pre-T20 World Cup discussions, the potent bowling unit has quietly become the team's real strength.  Bowlers like Varun Chakravarthy and Arshdeep Singh, alongside the consistent brilliance of Jasprit Bumrah, provide crucial confidence and have been instrumental in securing victories, proving they are the key to defending their title.

title: Karnataka BJP MLA Chandru Lamani caught taking Rs 5 lakh bribe
content: Chandru Lamani, BJP MLA from Shirahatti in Gadag, was caught by Lokayukta police allegedly accepting a Rs 5 lakh bribe during a raid at his Balaji Hospital in Laxmeshwar. Acting on contractor Vijay Pujar’s complaint over an 11% commission demand, police detained Lamani and his aides, who allegedly tried to dispose of cash.

title: Watch: Footage captures devastation after Pakistani strikes on Afghan madrassa
content: Pakistani air strikes targeted seven militant camps in Afghanistan, including a religious madrassa. Islamabad stated the operations were in response to recent suicide bombings within Pakistan, blaming militants operating from Afghan soil. Kabul condemned the strikes, accusing Pakistani generals of deflecting from their own security failures. Relations between the two neighbours have deteriorated sharply since the Taliban returned to power in 2021.

title: New glitch hits Moon mission: Why did Nasa delay Artemis II again
content: NASA's Artemis II mission faces a delay as engineers discovered an issue with helium flow in the rocket's propulsion stage. This fault necessitates rolling the rocket back to the Vehicle Assembly Building for repairs, pushing back the planned March launch. The problem echoes a similar glitch during the Artemis I mission, prompting a thorough investigation into potential causes.

title: Incensed Trump raises tariffs from 10% to 15% causing more trade turmoil
content: President Trump escalated global tariffs to 15% following a Supreme Court rebuff, citing Section 122 of the Trade Act to address balance-of-payments deficits. This move, driven by pique, is expected to disrupt global trade and faces potential legal challenges due to inconsistent trade balances with various nations.

title: T20 WC: Pre-seeding, venue comfort leave India, SA with no excuses in Super 8s
content: As the T20 World Cup enters the Super 8s, last edition's finalists India and South Africa prepare for a crucial clash in Ahmedabad. Both teams, having faced scares in the group stage, now face immense pressure with little room for error. Familiarity with the venue and opponents is high, but the mental game will be key.

title: Bride's pet dog sparks violent clash in UP, wedding cancelled
content: A wedding in Fatehpur turned violent after a pet dog's barking led to a brawl between the bride's and groom's families. The disturbance during rituals escalated when the groom's side allegedly attacked the animal, resulting in a physical fight. At least five people were injured, and the ceremony was called off. No formal complaint has been lodged yet.

title: 57-year-old kidnapped Sikh man found dead in US
content: Avtar Singh, a 57-year-old cook at a California gurdwara, has been found dead after being kidnapped. Surveillance footage showed him being forced into a white SUV by three unidentified individuals. Singh had previously served at the Damdami Taksal headquarters.

title: SL vs ENG: Adil Rashid–Maheesh Theekshana battle on cards amid Kandy rain threat
content: Rain threatens to disrupt the T20 World Cup Super 8 clash between Sri Lanka and England in Kandy. Both teams have shown inconsistent form, with England's captain admitting they were too cautious with the bat. Sri Lanka relies heavily on opener Pathum Nissanka, while England's spin attack, led by Adil Rashid, poses a significant threat.

title: India & Brazil sign rare earths pact, will ‘wait and watch’ US SC tariff order fallout
content: India and Brazil inked a critical minerals agreement and set a $30 billion trade target by 2030, aiming to build resilient supply chains and reduce dependence on China. Leaders also discussed UN reforms and technology cooperation, emphasizing Global South solidarity and shared progress.

title: 'It's on the way': Donald Trump is sending 'great hospital boat' to Greenland
content: President Trump announced plans to send a hospital boat to Greenland to aid those reportedly not receiving adequate care. This initiative follows Trump's repeated assertions of Greenland's strategic importance and his past proposals to purchase the Arctic island, which Denmark and Greenland officials have consistently rejected.

title: Shikhar Dhawan marries Sophie Shine: Former cricketer weds in private ceremony
content: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan has tied the knot with his partner Sophie Shine in a private ceremony. The couple, who reportedly met in Dubai, shared heartwarming pictures from their wedding, including traditional rituals and celebratory dances. Shine, an Irish product consultant, also actively participates in Dhawan's ventures, heading his foundation and serving as COO of Da One Sports.

title: T20 WC: Can Pakistan still qualify for semi-final after PAK vs NZ washout?
content: Rain washed out the Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match, with both teams sharing one point and the semi-final race wide open. Pakistan must beat England and Sri Lanka to reach five points and likely qualify, while any loss could make their chances depend on other results. New Zealand face a similar situation, with wins now crucial to stay in control of their campaign.

title: 120 strike rate, just three sixes: SKY says Tilak Varma 'told to bat that way'
content: Captain Suryakumar Yadav backed Tilak Varma, stating his batting approach aligns with team strategy, especially after early wickets. While acknowledging Tilak's personal dissatisfaction, Yadav expressed confidence in his ability to perform. He dismissed suggestions of replacing Tilak and highlighted the team's adaptability to challenging pitches, emphasizing faith in the bowling unit to defend scores.

title: Human Rights Commission launches investigation into newborn’s death in Kerala hospital
content: The family alleged that the doctor failed to communicated the possibility of complications and claimed that prolonging the labour and failing to conduct the C-section in a timely manner had led to the death

title: Telangana BJP chief Ramchander Rao arrested, prevented from going to ‘tense’ Kamareddy
content: The BJP leader was kept under house arrest to foil his attempts to go to Kamareddy and later Banswara

title: Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat & Meerut Metro launch: full route, fares, and timings explained
content: The Prime Minister will dedicate the entire 82 km Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor, which is designed to provide high-speed, high-frequency connectivity between Delhi and Meerut

title: Maoists general secretary reportedly surrenders before Telangana police
content: Devji is believed to have taken over as the Maoist general secretary after the encounter of Nambala Keshava Rao

title: Maan ki Baat: PM Modi urges citizens to ‘be alert against digital arrest scams’
content: Prime Minister said “At AI Impact Summit, world leaders were impressed by AI breakthroughs in treatment of animals and 24x7 help to farmers”

title: Troops spot terrorists in Kishtwar, firefight on: Army
content: The gunfight started when Army troops launched a search operation in Chatroo forests following information about the presence of two suspected terrorists, the officials said

title: Woman brutally assaulted by live-in partner in Gurugram, FIR registered
content: The FIR, registered based on the victim’s statement, states that Shivam was having a physical relationship with her under the pretext of marriage, thrashing her and subjecting her to violence

title: Victoria student’s hostel in Chennai: Regal, but in need of attention
content: The hostel, coming under the Presidency College, stands on what was once called Chepauk Park, a triangular stretch of land on the west bank of the canal behind Presidency College

title: In Frames: Unearthing the silent splendour of Hoysalas
content: In the rural parts of Hassan, Mandya and Mysuru in Karnataka, overlooked Hoysala-era temples and basadis reveal a thriving medieval kingdom’s devotion and sculptural mastery; through star-shaped platforms, serene shrines, finely sculpted pillars and quiet stepwells, the Hoysala imagination continues to whisper through stone

title: Five police personnel die in head-on collision between their vehicle and truck in Odisha
content: Five cops died, and three others sustained severe injuries in the deadly collision, in Jharsuguda district on February 22

title: Uttarakhand CM approves action against ineligible beneficiaries drawing dual pensions
content: The direction came on February 21, 2026 after a recent data analysis by the CAG related to government pensions in Uttarakhand uncovered alleged irregularities, revealing that 1,377 people in the State were receiving double pension benefits

title: Palaniswami assures people of bringing back hawala money stashed abroad in the event of victory
content: Palaniswami alleged that the ruling DMK had “appropriated” all the additional revenue earned by the State government and the “hawala’ money had been  placed abroad

title: Why has eastern Nagaland got autonomy? | Explained
content: What does the Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority offer to six ‘backward’ districts of the State?

title: St. Xavier’s University, Kolkata confers D.Litt on Shashi Tharoor at seventh convocation
content: Authorities of St Xavier’s University announced a number of new academic programmes including B. Tech degree course from 2026.  The convocation ceremony saw degrees being awarded to 1052 postgraduate and undergraduate students and 25 Ph.D scholars

title: Why has NGT cleared the Nicobar project? | Explained
content: Why does the government insist that the project is of strategic importance? What will India achieve by establishing a major cargo transshipment hub? What will happen to the biodiversity of the Great Nicobar Island? What are the concerns? Can coral colonies be translocated?

title: Akhilesh questions removal of NSG cover, accuses BJP government of 'playing' with his security
content: "The BJP government is playing with my security. I had NSG security, but it was withdrawn. The government should have disclosed why," Akhilesh Yadav said, alleging that security decisions were being politicised.

title: Five school teachers held in Odisha for 'raping' 13-year-old girl
content: The arrests were made after the father of the class 7 student and the district child welfare committee lodged separate complaints at the Rajkanika police station, alleging that the accused teachers had raped the minor, a senior officer said.

title: IED recovered behind police post in Amritsar
content: Police said the improvised explosive device (IED) was later defused, and an FIR was registered at the Beas police station. An investigation is underway, they added.

title: Estranged CPI(M) leader Pratikur Rahaman joins Trinamool Congress
content: Pratikur Rahaman alleged that he was being sidelined within the party and pointed fingers at CPI(M) State Secretary Md. Salim

title: Omar Abdullah pleads with Delhi to keep beating ordinary Kashmiri youth: J&K LoP Sunil Sharma
content: The LoP said around 23,000 jobs were outsourced in J&K. “This decision has shattered the dreams of thousands of unemployed youth and amounts to a betrayal,” he added.

title: Actor Mammootty meets landslide survivor
content: Sandhya, who sustained injuries in the landslide, recently underwent a surgery at the hospital to fit the artificial limb

title: Farm politics intensifies in west U.P. over India-U.S. deal
content: BKU’s Tikait faction seeks clarity from the govt. on the impact of the trade deal on farmers, takes on Jayant Chaudhary; concerns unfounded: RLD; khaps discuss direct and indirect impact of deal

title: How SimpleGov initiative is simplifying processes for government services
content: These simplification efforts, however, were far from simple as several Acts and government orders had to be amended accordingly to facilitate the process

title: India set to emerge as world’s third-largest economy: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi
content: The Minister says that after the United States, the United Kingdom, and China, India is making significant strides in the academic sphere

title: Former Speaker P. Dhanapal’s son joins TVK in Chennai
content: According to TVK sources, Cathrine Ezhilmalai, former Union Minister Dalit Ezhilmalai’s daughter, and Chakkaravarthy, freedom fighter Immanuel Sekaran’s grandson, have also joined the party

title: Thai University confers honorary doctorate to VIT vice-president in Vellore
content: The honorary degree symbolises the highest level of academic recognition bestowed by the institution for distinguished service and professional excellence

title: Ramalinga Reddy opens Living Spaces 2026, The Hindu Group’s annual realty expo
content: IDBI Bank’s pan India home loan book size was ₹72,000 crore as on December 31, 2025. Mumbai accounted for the major chunk of these loans followed by Bengaluru with a share of ₹13,000 core, indicating a spurt in home sales

title: Kingston Engineering College near Katpadi becomes autonomous
content: D.M. Kathir Anand, college chairman and Vellore MP, urged the faculty members to continue their cooperation and collaboration in steering the college towards greater heights in its next phase of growth and development

title: Comparing separation of powers jurisprudence between India and U.S. based on recent SCOTUS ruling
content: The International Emergency Economic Powers Act’s half-century of existence has never witnessed the national emergency law being used by the Executive to such a distinct and sweeping extent

title: 900 police personnel to be deployed for TVK’s meeting in Vellore on February 23, says SP
content: For the Vellore event, the police restricted the total number of participants to 4,900 persons due to hot weather

title: Police seize 21 kg ganja at Katpadi railway station
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the suspect had bought ganja from drug peddlers in Andhra Pradesh to sell in retail to individuals and workers at key towns and industrial centres in the State

title: Estimates notwithstanding, T.N. government is hopeful of sticking to fiscal norms
content: Referring to the savings of about ₹5,710 crore in non-development expenditure, the government is optimistic about achieving the targets, which have, of course, been set in “the absence of new external fiscal challenges”

title: Corporators discuss summer preparedness in VMC council meeting
content: They call for steps to ensure clean and safe drinking water to residents, highlight supply of discoloured water in some areas, and stress the need to check mosquito menace; TDP and YSRCP members spar over progress of works under Nadu-Nedu

title: BJP holds nationwide demonstrations, political parties denounce Youth Congress protest at AI summit
content: The Congress party faces criticism from several quarters of the political spectrum for backing the ‘shirtless’ stir by Youth Congress workers at the India AI Impact Summit venue

title: Calcutta High Court cancels judicial officers’ leaves to assist SIR
content: All leave, except under medical emergency, granted earlier to any judicial officer, stands cancelled till March 9, and those already on leave were directed to join their respective courts and offices by February 23

title: Tech knowledge essential for comprehensive development, says H.K. Patil
content: Dr. Patil said the animal husbandry sector forms the backbone of the rural economy, and farmers’ income can be enhanced by adopting scientific methods, modern technology and animal welfare practices.

title: SIR: Thiruvananthapuram district has a little over 25.26 lakh voters
content: This number is 3.21 lakh lower compared to the October 27, 2025, list which had 28,47,907 voters, but higher by 86,083 voters compared to the draft electoral roll published on December 23, 2025

title: Need to recalibrate Union-State relations as centralisation has failed to deliver: M.K. Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu CM disseminates Part I of a report by the High-Level Committee on Union-State Relations, headed by Justice Kurian Joseph; says Centre must stay focused on national responsibilities, restore States’ autonomy

title: Vice-President releases updated Constitution editions in Tamil and Gujarati
content: The release of the foundational document in regional languages coincided with International Mother Language Day marked every year on February 21

title: Protest at AI summit: court sends four Youth Congress workers to five-day police custody
content: The police claim that the aim of the custodial interrogation is to find out the ‘conspiracy’ behind the protest, the source of funding and place where the T-shirts worn by the accused were printed at.

title: Uttar Pradesh POCSO court orders registration of FIR against Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati
content: Mr. Saraswati accused of sexually abusing two children at his ashram under the guise of ‘guru seva’ during the Magh Mela in Prayagraj; despite written complaints to Police Commissioner, no FIR was filed

title: Election Commission to deploy central forces in West Bengal from March 1
content: Sources at the Commission said that the early deployment of CAPF was a confidence-building measure for the electors of West Bengal

title: Nearly 8% of voters removed from final electoral lists across six States and three U.T.s in SIR second phase
content: Combined number of voters in nine States and U.T.s fell from 21,45,62,215 to 19,75,33,701 after the SIR, with net deletions of 1,70,28,514 or 7.93%. Final lists of West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu are yet to be published

title: Number of permanent faculty in the best universities in the world is low: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot appealed to the Chief Minister to present the forthcoming State Budget in a manner that is more beneficial to the higher education sector

title: Hebbal-Sarjapur Metro corridor awaits nod amid design objections
content: The ₹28,405-crore Hebbal-Sarjapur line was cleared by the Karnataka Cabinet in December 2024, but requires final approval from the Centre

title: Bagalkot returning to normalcy; entry of Muthalik, Kerehalli barred for a month
content: However, as a precautionary measure, the police have beefed up security, especially around the Panka mosque and surrounding areas where the instances of violence were reported.

title: ‘Changes in stipend payment for medical interns may require further talks’
content: Public health activists and students’ unions have been claiming that the interns in private medical colleges are paid less compared with their counterparts in government medical colleges

title: I am ‘targeted’, but won’t be a ‘coward’, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, setting off more speculation
content: That is why, as long as I breathe, I will fight against this political conspiracy and against the politics of hatred and jealousy, says Siddaramaiah

title: Congress leader R. Reshmi joins BJP
content: She contested against Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal in the Kottarakara constituency in the 2021 State Assembly elections

title: Congress soul of nation and Congress-mukt Bharat will remain a dream: Revanth Reddy
content: Chief Minister recalls sacrifices of national leaders, says Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru went to jail for the country while Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi laid down their lives for the nation; alleges that BJP was conspiring against the Congress and Gandhi family

title: No proposal to increase BMTC, KSRTC fares, clarifies Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy
content: The clarification comes after several posts were circulated online claiming that fares of State-run transport corporations, including BMTC and KSRTC, were set to be revised

title: Kerala SIR: 11 districts record dip in voters, three show increase
content: Thiruvananthapuram records steepest dip of 3.21 lakh voters and Malappuram shows highest increase with 2.02 lakh voters

title: EC publishes final voters list for Chhattisgarh; SC-ST and minorities’ names deleted intentionally, alleges Congress
content: The Election Commission says there has been an increase of 2,34,994 voters in the final list over the draft rolls published earlier

title: UNICEF delegation to visit child rights panel in Kerala on Monday
content: The commission and UNICEF is in partnership on advocating the need to address non-communicable diseases among children in the State

title: Kerala’s Nativity card Bill moots penalties for submitting false details
content: The Kerala Nativity Card Bill is likely to be tabled in the current session of the Assembly, which will resume on Monday

title: President Droupadi Murmu refers Secunderabad Cantonment merger issue to Defence Ministry
content: The information was communicated in a letter by the President’s Secretariat to Secunderabad Cantonment MLA Sri Ganesh Narayanan

title: BJYM condemns Youth Congress conduct at AI Summit
content: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha stages protests in Ongole and Tirupati, burns Rahul Gandhi effigy over shirtless demonstration during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s inauguration of international summit in New Delhi

title: After SIR exercise, Rajasthan publishes final electoral roll with 5.15 crore voters
content: The names of 31.36 lakh voters were removed from the electoral rolls during the SIR, which began in November 2025, says Chief Electoral Officer Naveen Mahajan; the final electoral roll depicted a net increase of 10,48,605 voters in comparison with the draft publication, reflecting a growth of 2.08%

title: What we learned in Duke's win over Michigan
content: Duke is as good as any team, and all the ingredients that made Michigan a dominant squad weren't there.

title: Former Purdue, NFL receiver Moore dies at 25
content: Former Purdue and NFL wide receiver Rondale Moore died Saturday at the age of 25, according to the Minnesota Vikings.

title: Sources: Suns lose Brooks to broken left hand
content: Suns guard Dillon Brooks broke his left hand in Saturday's game against Orlando and is expected to miss an extended period of time, sources told ESPN.

title: McGregor teases return, open to fight 'no name'
content: In a social media post on Saturday, Conor McGregor, who is 22-6 but has been out of action since July 2021, once again teased the possibility of a return to competition, this time against a "no name" opponent, asking the UFC to "send the contract, lads."

title: Boozer leads Blue Devils past Wolverines in D.C.
content: Cameron Boozer scored 18 points, and the No. 3 Duke Blue Devils handed another neutral-site loss to fellow blueblood Michigan, knocking off the top-ranked Wolverines 68-63 on Saturday in a raucous possible Final Four preview in the nation's capital.

title: Strickland stops Hernandez, wants Chimaev next
content: Sean Strickland scored his first stoppage victory in more than two years, finishing Anthony Hernandez in the third round Saturday night before calling for champion Khamzat Chimaev.

title: Garcia wrests Barrios' WBC title in one-sided win
content: Ryan Garcia delivered perhaps the most complete performance of his career, dropping Mario Barrios early and cruising to a unaniomous decision to win the WBC welterweight title.

title: Sources: Cowboys agree to deal with RB Williams
content: The Cowboys and free-agent-to-be running back Javonte Williams reached agreement on a three-year contract that includes $16 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Saturday.

title: UCLA swats 'negativity,' authors 23-point rally
content: Donovan Dent hit a layup with one second remaining in overtime, lifting UCLA over No. 10 Illinois 95-94 on Saturday after the Bruins rallied from a 23-point deficit, the program's largest comeback since rallying from 19 down in a 2019 victory over Oregon.

title: 🫧 Men's NCAA tournament Bubble Watch
content: The Bulldogs padded their NCAA tournament case with another key victory just days after beating Kentucky.

title: Women's Bracketology: Can red-hot Duke get to a No. 2 seed?
content: The Blue Devils have won 17 consecutive games. They're undefeated in ACC play. But they remain a 3-seed.

title: Boxing results: Ryan Garcia dominates Mario Barrios, wins first title
content: Ryan Garcia became the WBC welterweight champion with an impressive victory over Mario Barrios on Saturday.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: Bridgeman on brink of first PGA title at Genesis
content: Jacob Bridgeman came out firing Saturday at Riviera and never let up until he had the low score of the day at 7-under 64 and a six-shot lead over Rory McIlroy in the Genesis Invitational.

title: How does an NFL player decide to retire? 'I'm not done'
content: Eric Weddle, Tony Jefferson and Andrew Whitworth share stories of their journeys in and out of retirement.

title: College football's 100 best quarterbacks of the 2000s
content: Make way for Fernando Mendoza and others on Bill Connelly's updated list of the greatest quarterbacks of the century.

title: Jodhpur Sisters, Aged 25 And 23, Die By Suicide On Their Wedding Day
content: A household which was preparing for the wedding festivities of their two daughters was plunged into sadness when the sisters died the same day in Jodhpur's Manai village, with officials saying both women allegedly consumed a poisonous substance.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S.' first-ever mass start medal, women's freeski halfpipe final postponed
content: The penultimate day at the Olympics felt like the calm before the storm. After Team USA women's ice hockey won gold against Canada in a thrilling match on Thursday, the American men followed up by advancing to the gold medal match by defeating Slovakia on Friday. They'll have a day off before facing Canada in the gold medal match Sunday, the last event of the 2026 Winter Olympics before the closing ceremony. That's not to say there was nothing happening on Saturday. Team USA women's curling fell short in a bronze medal match against Canada, and Mia Manganello won a bronze medal in the mass start, the U.S.'s first medal in that event. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Follow live with the best events from Saturday below.
